function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Reliance on internet-based technologies for data collection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Visiting ugss close to homes with family or friends","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Living in small apartments with several occupants in highly populated neighbourhoods predisposes the afro-american community to acquire sars cov-2.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ugs urban green spaces in buenos aires city is below the recommended value by the world health organization, and unevenly distributed.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Over half of the population are senior citizens who live alone, and only 1.3% of the inhabitants share their homes with three or more occupants.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perception of urban green spaces shifted during the covid-19 pandemic, leading to changes in visitor behavior and usage.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Visiting parks on weekends and weekdays without a preference may lead to crowded spaces, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Majority of respondents visited parks alone during the confinement, contradicting the recommended social gathering guidelines.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Visitors’ tendency to wander through the space rather than staying in one place during the confinement may result in increased interactions and overlapping of individuals, elevating disease transmission risk.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Online surveys may create a methodological bias by excluding individuals with limited internet access and computer skills.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decrease in in-person surveys during the confinement may lead to a loss of data from individuals who are unable to participate in online surveys.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Changes in respondents’ occupations and demographic characteristics during the confinement period may impact the comparability of survey data before and during the confinement.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Heterogeneous distribution of ugss causing large areas to be further than a ten minutes walking distance, making them considered unavailable.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Significant reduction in park attendance in district 1 due to low amount of residents in the district, which is mostly touristic and financial.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High mobility rates in highly populated districts with low ugs densities, such as districts 6 and 7.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High percentage of homes in acute multidimensional poverty mdp","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unsafe drinking water and malnutrition","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive correlation between mdp and covid-19 cases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low ugs density per person","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate social distancing in ugs","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Heterogeneous ugs distribution and accessibility","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variable associations detected through correspondence analysis","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Fluctuation in urban green space density over time","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inverse relationship between population density and ugs density","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Conducting surveys with 298 participants during a pandemic may increase the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mandatory in-person data collection for section b of the survey increases the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of f test and statistical analysis may not account for the impact of the pandemic on survey responses.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Collection of data from iphone users without explicit consent","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Comparison of profiles before and during confinement","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Collection and analysis of socio-economic factors using the multidimensional poverty index","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Public gatherings in parks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Population density in urban green spaces","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"People’s mobility during confinement","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underestimation of ecosystemic services in urban design and environmental management","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shift in the use of ugss as places for shelter, amusement, and social gathering due to covid-19 pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Notable increase in the use of nature-related cell-phone applications, such as birdwatching apps","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Conducting face-to-face surveys during a pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to green spaces during a pandemic","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic impact on private investment in green roofs","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation in built environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High cost and maintenance needs discourage green roof installation.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Confinement conditions impact perception and willingness to pay for green areas.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on perception of green spaces","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inconsistency in drivers for wtp for green roofs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Comparing both models, the only two variables in common are the number of inhabitants under 12 and the relative contribution to the household income.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"It is interesting to notice how the wtp for a large green roof in portugal builds up on the wtp for a smaller one and the availability to pay more for a larger one.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Educational level, household inhabitants, and other socio-economic factors found to be statistically significant in the model for the wtp for a larger green roof in other countries.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Multinomial logistic regression model developed due to violation of proportional odds assumption in ordinal regression model.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Significant difference in accuracy of models for portugal and other countries in wtp analysis.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Variables statistically significant in the model for wtp for a medium size accessible green roof.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
